org.incava.ijdk.collect

Class Iterate

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.incava.ijdk.collect.Iterate

  • public class Iterate
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates various types of Iterators, all of which are null safe (they can accept a null input).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Iterate() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer> count(int num)
      Returns an iterator to be executed num times.
      static <T> ItIterable<T> each(java.lang.Iterable<T> elements)
      An iterator that has a value (it.value()) and an index (it.index()).
      static <T> ItIterable<T> each(T[] ary)
      An iterator that has a value (it.value()) and an index (it.index()).
      static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> over(java.lang.Iterable<T> elements)
      Returns an Iterable (iterator) for the collection, which can be null.
      static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> over(T[] ary)
      Returns an Iterable (iterator) for the C-style array, which can be null.
      static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> overNonNull(java.lang.Iterable<T> elements)
      Returns an Iterable (iterator) for the collection, which can be null.

      • count

        public static java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer> count(int num)
        Returns an iterator to be executed num times.
        Parameters:
        num - the number of times to iterate
        Returns:
        an iterator

      • over

        public static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> over(T[] ary)
        Returns an Iterable (iterator) for the C-style array, which can be null. If ary is null, an "empty" iterator will be returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements
        Parameters:
        ary - the array to iterate over; can be null
        Returns:
        an iterator for the array
        See Also:
        each(T[])

      • over

        public static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> over(java.lang.Iterable<T> elements)
        Returns an Iterable (iterator) for the collection, which can be null. If coll is null, an "empty" iterator will be returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements
        Parameters:
        elements - the elements to iterate over; can be null
        Returns:
        an iterator for the collection
        See Also:
        each(T[])

      • overNonNull

        public static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> overNonNull(java.lang.Iterable<T> elements)
        Returns an Iterable (iterator) for the collection, which can be null. If coll is null, an "empty" iterator will be returned. Only non-null elements will be in the Iterable.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements
        Parameters:
        elements - the elements to iterate over; can be null
        Returns:
        an iterator for the collection
        See Also:
        each(T[])

      • each

        public static <T> ItIterable<T> each(T[] ary)
        An iterator that has a value (it.value()) and an index (it.index()). 
             for (It<String> it : Iterate.each(array)) {
         System.out.println("element #" + it.index() + ": " + it.value());
     }
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements
        Parameters:
        ary - the array to iterate over; can be null
        Returns:
        an iterator for the array
        See Also:
        over(T[]), It

      • each

        public static <T> ItIterable<T> each(java.lang.Iterable<T> elements)
        An iterator that has a value (it.value()) and an index (it.index()). 
             for (It<String> it : Iterate.each(list)) {
         System.out.println("element #" + it.index() + ": " + it.value());
     }
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements
        Parameters:
        elements - the elements to iterate over; can be null
        Returns:
        an iterator for the elements
        See Also:
        over(T[]), It
